meanings.sent1: The community reded the newly renovated park with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: She reded her life to helping others after the inspiring volunteer work.
meanings.sent3: The old library was reded with a giant ribbon-cutting event.
meanings.sent4: After the setback, he reded himself to his studies with renewed determination.
meanings.sent5: The team reded their efforts to winning the championship, practicing tirelessly.

meanings.definition: To commit or devote oneself anew.
meanings.sent1: He reded his time to learning a new skill after the summer break.
meanings.sent2: She rededicated herself to her passion for painting after a long hiatus.
meanings.sent3: The group reded their commitment to environmental causes with a tree-planting event.
meanings.sent4: After the setback, she rededicated herself to achieving her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The athlete reded his training to improving his performance for the upcoming competition.

meanings.sent1: They reded their loyalty to the team by renewing their vows.
meanings.sent2: She reded her support to the cause by attending the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The couple reded their love with a heartfelt anniversary celebration.
meanings.sent4: After the misunderstanding, he reded his trust to their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The nation reded their allegiance to the flag during the national holiday.
